My Cap Is

Capilano University has served the North Shore for over 40 years and is renowned for its unique programs and dedicated faculty.

The 2013/14 budget proposed by the University executive was made without regard for our University’s mission and vision. The budget was also made without consulting students, faculty, or the local community.

The $3 million in proposed cuts affects core programs and courses, including Studio Arts, Textile Arts, Interactive Design, Computing Science, Commerce, Community Outreach and Development, and the Computer Learning Centre, among others.

The faculty is united in adamantly opposing the cuts and is eager to find alternative solutions.

MyCapIs.ca is the daily voice of the University faculty, students and staff.

We want to hit the pause button on these cuts, before they destroy what’s taken decades to build. Join us. Tell the University's Board of Governors to reject the budget in their vote on May 14.
